thread.title: These 3 Georgia colleges give every freshman a scholarship
thread.title_full: These 3 Georgia colleges give every freshman a scholarship | www.ajc.com

author: Lauren Colley
title: These 3 Georgia colleges give every freshman a scholarship
text:
While many scholarships aren't a guarantee, these are a sure bet.
Money identified schools that offer every freshman a scholarship, and have at or above average graduation rates.
• Agnes Scott College in Decatur, costs an estimated $49,749. On average, the school offers freshmen a grant of $20,754.
• Wesleyan College in Macon, costs an estimated $33,919. On average, the school offers freshmen a grant of $9,590.
• Berry College in Mount Berry, costs an estimated $45,991. On average, the school offers freshmen a grant of $13,955.
While many private colleges give scholarships to roughly 90% of freshmen to attract applicants, counselors advise students to evaluate the true net price of attending a school.
For more on nearly 100 more colleges across the country that offer freshman scholarships, click here .
